majsan

funky front-end with a touch of concepting

about.

I’m Majsan, a colorful source of energy, curious explorer and professional ice breaker. With great communication as a tool and unlimited funkiness as a strength I believe I can make this world a bit less grey, whether it’s about creating a badass campaign or putting a smile on somebody’s face.

For me it’s important to build and maintain a great group culture in able to work efficiently, and of course have fun along the way. What really motivates me is to conquer new learnings, meet new inspiring people and push my boundaries.

I’m a front-end developer with a twist; apart from coding sexy front-end I really like to create solid concepts. Since I’m also born with two sharp eyes and a cocky left brain half I can’t help but make sure that all the pieces fall into place nicely, even from a distance.

education & experience.

  • Front-end developer, Label A, Sep 2016 - current.
  • Front-end developer intern, MediaMonks, Nov 2015 - May 2016.
  • Digital Media Creative, Hyper Island, Aug 2014 - June 2016.
  • B.A. Advertising & PR, Stockholm University, 2012 - 2014.

royal canin.

development

As part of my front-end internship at MediaMonks I was a part of building the Royal Family by Royal Canin. It's a platform that lets the user explore different dog breeds, find it's perfect dog based on preferences, living situation and needs as well as create a personal account to get tailored updates.

Concept and design by DDB & Tribal Amsterdam and production by MediaMonks, where I did templating for the site which included HTML, Sass and Javascript (Typescript).

check out website ➞

midwives4all.

concept/strategy/copy/development

As part of tiny studio I created a campaign for Swedens's Ministry of Foreign Affairs' initiative midwives4all. The brief was to raise awareness of the problems of maternal and newborn death in low income countries, but mainly focus on spreading awareness about the benefits of midwifery and the important role midwives have for ensuring a safe pregnancy and motherhood. The long term goal for maternal and newborn health to be a prioritized topic in every country and government.

We used thunderclap, which is a powerful crowd speaking tool, to reach out to as many people as possible. In addition to that we created a twitter recruiter where a country is targeted and influencial twitter users can be encouraged to join the cause.

The campaign successfully reached a big amount of people and got supported by UN Women and Kofi Annan among others.

check out the campaign ➞

whatkindof.me.

concept/art direction/copy/development

A Hyper Island project I did together with a friend where the task simply was to build a website related to internet privacy that would contribute with something good to the world. Our insights were that a lot of people don't put any value in their password security, but easily share their private information without any critical thinking.

We created a cute and innocent looking bait-and-switch quiz to remind people that the internet can be a dangerous place for those who're not cautious.

check out the full quiz ➞

2cool4gluten.

concept/art direction/development

Two years ago I got diagnosed with gluten intolerance and ever since I've been struggling to find nice meat- and gluten free recipes (that are not only salad!). Inspired by awesome "whatthefuckshouldimakefordinner", I created 2cool4gluten, a veggie gluten free recipe generator.

go to website ➞
